1: Replace the array with a set to store the numbers. This change optimizes the time complexity of checking existence and inserting an element.
2: Remove the initialization of the array, as a fixed-size array is no longer needed.
3: Insert the initial number into the set.
4: Update the logic in the loop to simplify the operations: Apply the division/multiplication to the number whether it is even or odd first.
5: Check if the number is already in the set by comparing the size of the set with the current iteration index plus one. If they are not equal, it indicates a repetition.
6: Inside the loop, after updating the number, add it to the set.
7: Remove unnecessary increment of counter operations as they are not required in the new logic.
